newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatian tourism up on 1995, expects $1.3 bln.
newsitem.headline: Croatian tourism up on 1995, expects $1.3 bln.

text.p: Croatia's once lucrative tourist industry expects to earn $ 1.3 billion by the end of the year, over 50 percent up on 1995, when four-year long war with rebel minority Serbs ended, state news agency reported on Tuesday.
National Bank governor Marko Skreb, addressing a presidential council session on tourism, also said tourist income was expected to reach $3 billion in 2001, HINA said.
Tourism in federal Yugoslavia, from which Croatia seceded in 1991, cashed in during its best seasons up to $4.5 billion per year. At least half of it was made on Croatia's Adriatic coast.
